name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Argentina has passed a new tax on its wealthiest people to pay for its response to Coronavirus.  That's exactly what we should do.

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: I drove past this mural yesterday over on Kirkstall Road and have just seen this wonderful video from @LUFC all about it.  So great that children have been able to tell their stories - and the story of our diverse city - through art and through this video.  https://t.co/CD9goeMCJ7

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: My advice sessions for East Leeds residents are one of my favourite parts of the week. It’s great to be able to help people in our area.  Issues raised today included government failure to ensure sufficient truly affordable homes for people here in East Leeds and across the UK.  https://t.co/WVoXP2Dcrv

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: While cutting public sector pay and underinvesting in our NHS, the Tory government plans to increase military spending by £16bn.   Join me and Jeremy Corbyn at this @labourcnd meeting looking at how we campaign for investment in public services, not war.  https://t.co/vuzz0IZF44

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Data source:  https://t.co/3UVsJ4qhyF which for this period uses the European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control and Johns Hopkins University datasets.

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: The Gov't tries to give the impression it's handled this crisis well.  It's a lie.  Covid deaths over the past 100 days  🇬🇧UK - 18,658 🇦🇺Australia - 336 🇰🇷South Korea - 223 🇨🇳China - 32 🇻🇳Vietnam - 5 🇳🇿New Zealand - 3 🇹🇭Thailand - 2  The other countries had a Zero Covid strategy.

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Proud to take part in the Harehills Christmas Lights Switch On virtual event project last night.   Well done to everyone involved! Proud of the community spirit in Harehills.  Looking forward to us all being able to get together safely for the Harehills Light Switch On next year.

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: "High value" business travellers are going to be exempted from quarantine.  Absolutely unbelievable.   It really is one rule for the rich and another for everyone else with this government.

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Proud to be one of more than 400 representatives from Parliaments around the world to write to @Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos backing the call to  https://t.co/CTlxoICrs0.  Let’s back the new global movement mobilising to demand justice from @Amazon.  https://t.co/WGNbjF4iro

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: As I told the Momentum/Arise rally calling for the whip to be reinstated to Jeremy, a clampdown on legitimate discussion in our Party is totally unacceptable.  Labour members must be treated with respect.  It's a basic democratic right that members can decide what they discuss.  https://t.co/9YQtvFOKrs

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: I’ve put down this Early Day Motion in Parliament (“Closure of Suicide Forums”) in support of their campaign:  https://t.co/utbRlvdbZt  MPs from 6 political parties have backed it so far.   Please do encourage your MP to back it too:  https://t.co/VuvVjUTFQu

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Joe Nihill, a former army cadet from Whinmoor, took his own life aged 23 after accessing online ‘suicide forums’.  Today I met with his inspiring and courageous mum, Catherine, and sister-in-law, Melanie, to discuss next steps in their campaign to get ‘suicide forums’ shut down.

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Today the UK surpassed 60,000 Covid deaths.   My heart goes out to all who have lost loved ones.  This was avoidable - responsibility lies with the Government's disastrous strategy.  The Government must do all it can to stop further deaths. Yet it's continuing to act recklessly.

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Students have been kept on campuses for no other reason than our marketised Higher Education system needs the income from their fees & rents.   After the successful Manchester occupation, students at Cambridge are now demanding justice.  Solidarity!   https://t.co/sllqjUBTED

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Jacob Rees-Mogg is reportedly set for an £800,000 dividend payment this year alone.  It would take someone on the current Statutory Sick Pay of £96 per week over 150 years to get that amount.  Today I called on Rees-Mogg to allow a debate on increasing sick pay.  He refused.  https://t.co/pSLnkOoiX9

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Today we mark the International Day for Disabled People.  Disabled people have borne the brunt of a decade of Tory austerity.   Solidarity with disabled people fighting against the cruel treatment of this Tory government and for a world of justice and equality.  #IDPD2020

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: There's a clear choice.  Will this crisis be paid for by those who’ve lost out through a decade of frozen wages & public service cuts?  Or by those who've done so well out of our rigged system?  Let’s put a windfall tax on those profiting from this crisis!  https://t.co/dFKqNS5Mlc

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Great to hear @JessicaLBarnard speak at the Socialist Campaign Group of Labour MPs meeting today.   @YoungLabourUK is demonstrating principled socialist leadership.  Solidarity.

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: 648 more UK Covid deaths today - the second-highest daily increase since May.  This awful news is the result of the government's reckless strategy.   And its plan for the coming weeks risks many more unnecessary deaths. Appalling.

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: The Covid vaccines must be distributed for free and allocated to those most in need.   No one should be able to pay to queue-jump.   #PeoplenotProfit

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Fantastic news.   With a vaccine likely to be widely available by Easter, it makes it all the more important that the Government doesn't gamble with people's lives over the coming weeks with an approach that risks the virus spiralling out of control again.  https://t.co/ieSQYAxP0s

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: I just voted against the Government's plan.  It'll fail to drive the virus down properly while we await a vaccine.  And the lack of decent sick pay is a disgrace.  The gov’t should learn from countries that have effectively eliminated the virus. Instead it's risking a Third Wave.

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Billions squandered on Serco and the like - and contracts having gone to those with links to top Tories.   Yet the Tory government still refuses to offer decent sick pay at real living wage levels.    Once again we see the rotten priorities of this government.

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: I‌ ‌will‌ ‌be‌ ‌voting‌ ‌against‌ ‌the‌ ‌Government's‌ ‌coronavirus proposals‌ ‌today.‌  https://t.co/UdraB64hqS

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Solidarity to @unitetheunion members at Heathrow taking strike action to fight disgraceful attacks on their pay and conditions.  These appalling #FireAndRehire plans could see workers permanently losing up to £8,000 per year - 25% of their pay.  Such practices must be outlawed.  https://t.co/uOAfK3bPT6

mentions.name: unite the union: join a union

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Today the important React-1 survey  showed there are still 72,000 new Covid infections every day.   That's dangerously high.  Yet the Govt's plan for the next few weeks is recklessly inadequate and risks a deadly Third Wave.  That's why I can't vote for its proposals tomorrow.

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: The government shouldn’t stop the truth coming out.  Who was pulling the strings behind the murder of lawyer Pat Finucane?   An independent public inquiry must happen.  https://t.co/HNPVkmVJCE

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: The government must hold an independent public inquiry into the murder of lawyer Pat Finucane.   An inquiry is needed because this is not about who pulled the trigger, but about who pulled the strings.     https://t.co/5nvDFHlfPU

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: We must reflect upon, and tackle, the rising tide of anti-Muslim prejudice and discrimination in our society.  A message to my constituents, reflecting upon Islamophobia Awareness Month 👇  https://t.co/fy1ITgOYEo

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: My statement on why I won’t be voting for the Government's new Covid Tier System this week   https://t.co/sDeVEU1or4  https://t.co/DsUiOdXHxi

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Instead of cuts to public sector pay, pathetic 37p increases in benefit levels and yet more public sector austerity, there should be a Windfall Tax on companies that have made superprofits from this crisis. Including those who got Covid contracts due to their links to top Tories.

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Today we mark the United Nations International Day of Solidarity with the Palestinian People.  When I went to Palestine, I saw with my own eyes the human rights abuses inflicted on the Palestinian people day in day out by the Israeli Govt.  Solidarity with the Palestinian people.  https://t.co/The0nbcvGE

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Jeremy Corbyn must have the whip reinstated.  And local Labour Parties have every right to discuss this.   Join us at this rally today.  https://t.co/uAtOlc7yA2  https://t.co/xE9rw4kOnz

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Our Government’s disastrous approach to fighting Covid has left us with one of the highest death tolls and deepest economic downturns.   Today I'm speaking at this conference on why we need a different Covid strategy.   Watch it here:  https://t.co/R0JCNj8ja6  https://t.co/0sCOURbnNP

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: My advice sessions for East Leeds residents are one of my favourite parts of the week because it’s great to be able to help people in our area.  Issues raised today included unsafe working conditions, lack of financial support during covid, housing conditions & care home service.  https://t.co/4BD6X1Upvh

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Today I met @foodwiseleeds based at @OldFireStaLS9 in Gipton to discuss the challenge to make this vision a reality in our city:  “The people of Leeds should have reliable access to sufficient, appropriate, and healthy food, which is safe, affordable and sustainably sourced.”  https://t.co/2WRK3T2uWt

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Sending British troops to defend the Saudi dictatorship's oil fields is the latest shameful example of Tory support for that brutal regime.  The Saudi-led war on Yemen is causing a humanitarian disaster.  End the arms sales. Stop these troop deployments.  https://t.co/VfHztKzdAp

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Amazon's owner Jeff Bezos is the world's richest person.  Yet his company pays tiny tax rates and its working conditions have left some with serious injuries.  It's time Amazon paid fair taxes and decent wages and put an end to its union busting practices.  #MakeAmazonPay

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: This morning I was proud to join the @unitetheunion virtual picket line alongside @RollsRoyce workers on the actual picket line at Barnoldswick.   Rolls Royce must ditch plans to offshore these vital jobs.     #BattleforBarnoldswick  https://t.co/yqDR7SKDlJ

mentions.name: unite the union: join a union

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: The government claims its Covid strategy is about saving lives and livelihoods.  It’s failing at both  The countries that have best saved lives - by driving down the virus - have also done best economically.  They did it by following a Zero Covid strategy.  https://t.co/LVHRcCzCuE

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: At this time of deep crisis, it's wrong that our government has increased military spending by £16bn while cutting the pay of teachers, firefighters & others.   We need to invest in welfare - not warfare.  Join me at this Stop the War meeting this Saturday  https://t.co/eJ9ztxPDk8

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Jeremy Corbyn - a Labour member and an MP - should have the whip restored so he's a Labour MP.   Members of Parliament have said so.  Affiliated trade unions have said so.  NEC members have said so.  Local Labour Party members shouldn't be prevented from saying say so too.

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: The Tories are playing their old game of divide and rule.  Pitting public sector against private-sector workers.  Next, it'll be the scapegoating of those on benefits.  Then migrants.  We've seen it time and time again.  Let's unite & fight for a society that serves the 99%.

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Mass testing only works if people are then given proper financial support to isolate.  People shouldn't have to choose between isolating to protect their health + putting food on the table.  That's why I've written to the Chancellor demanding proper sick pay at living wage levels  https://t.co/va6p8GaiAI

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: It's completely unacceptable that areas like Leeds that are in Tier 3 and have the toughest restrictions are not being given the extra financial support our areas need.  Businesses need an additional financial support package and people need proper sick pay to help them isolate.

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: These ongoing Covid restrictions are the result of Gov't failure:  ▪️locking down too slowly - ignoring the scientists + so prolonging the restrictions  ▪️messing up Test & Trace by handing billions to private companies  ▪️failing to provide proper sick pay to help people isolate

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Great to speak at this meeting tonight on the alternatives we need to Tory economic policies.  We need to step up the fight for investment in our public services, pay increases for key workers, proper sick pay for all, full employment and a Green New Deal.

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: This Government is trying to pay for this crisis on the backs of the working class.  Today in Parliament I called for a different approach - one where the richest few who've made super profits out of this crisis finally pay their fair share.  https://t.co/2v47OWbxUg

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Jeremy Corbyn must have the whip reinstated.  My interview on @BBCPolitics.  https://t.co/AOGsYrb28a

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Victims of Windrush have died without getting justice.  People have been wrongfully deported.   And the vast majority of victims still haven't been compensated.  Justice must be done.  My interview on @BBCPolitics  https://t.co/sLargAPgRI

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: When the Tories talk about “tough choices” what they mean is making the working class pay for this crisis.   It's never tough for the billionaires. Or for those who have done well out of their political links to the top Tories in this crisis.   My interview on @BBCPolitics  https://t.co/n4vVMdscwr

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: This crisis shouldn't be paid for on the backs of the working class.   Excellent demands from Unite the Union on what the Government must deliver in the Spending Review tomorrow.    And what the whole Labour movement needs to be fighting for.

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Our country’s extradition treaty with the USA is deeply flawed.   Cases like Julian Assange's have shone a spotlight on the issue of extradition between the US and UK.  Today I called on the Government to ensure the ban on extradition to the US for political offences is upheld.  https://t.co/wYJRHJwSvk

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: The Government is reportedly about to cancel a planned minimum wage rise.  That would be an attack on millions of low-paid workers, many on the frontline of our Covid response.  This must be fought all the way. This crisis must not be paid for on the backs of the working class.

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Join me, John McDonnell and other great speakers this Wednesday night to discuss how we respond to the Government's spending review.   We need to step up the fight for the Real Living Wage, proper sick pay for all, full employment and a Green New Deal.   https://t.co/X5G94K3RNt

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Sick pay is so low that many workers are forced to choose between putting food on the table or self-isolating.  People must be able to afford to isolate.  I've written to the Chancellor, along with 30 other MPs, demanding that sick pay is raised to real living wage levels.  https://t.co/glxGkYsXkr

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Today I met with @Leeds_Cares to discuss the extra help and support they give NHS patients and staff here in Leeds.  The charity, by providing extras above and beyond those for which our NHS is responsible, makes a real difference in our city.   More info:  https://t.co/2oCUbBwpJj  https://t.co/0OjJKpgatn

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: The Government - driven by pressure from right-wing Tory MPs, not public health needs - is risking a Coronavirus Third Wave.  https://t.co/TmSiysiwEF

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: The elected representatives of young members of our Party should not be treated in this way.  You have my full solidarity.

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: The public's efforts drove Coronavirus to very low levels in the summer - before the Gov't told people to go out and spend and get back to work & school.  Cases skyrocketed.  Now under pressure from right-wing Tory MPs, the Gov't is repeating its errors and risking a Third Wave.  https://t.co/tFHbpzLrNS

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: We need to kick Serco out and fix our broken Test & Trace system.  But that isn't enough.  We need proper Sick Pay so people can afford to isolate.  I've written to the Chancellor - along with 30 Labour MPs - demanding Sick Pay at Real Living Wage levels.  https://t.co/ywfzeoe46z

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: The Mirror on the inspiring campaign by the family of Joe Nihill from Whinmoor in East Leeds.  I’m proud to back Joe’s family’s campaign against ‘suicide forums’ and have put down a Parliamentary Motion calling for government action against such sites.  https://t.co/iQ4CTq7GVC

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Thatcher resigned 30 years ago today.   The task of the Labour Party must be to put an end to the free-market extremism she stood for.  And replace it with a society that serves the many not the few.

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Justice for Ricky Reel - I fully support this call for a new police investigation.  https://t.co/z1bHyPLkYT

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: It's outrageous that top Tories are using this crisis to give their mates publicly-funded jobs.  We need a full public inquiry into covid contracts and appointments now.  https://t.co/rhFrYE2Kfl

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: The decision to deny Jeremy Corbyn the whip flies in the face of Labour's own NEC hearing and creates division when Labour should be united behind the socialist alternatives our communities need to the Tories' disastrous Covid response.  Sign this petition: https://t.co/SMOIOCYuvc

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Joe Nihill from Whinmoor here in East Leeds took his own life in April following three bereavements and after accessing online forums that encourage suicide and even recommend methods.  I’m proud to back Joe’s family’s campaign against ‘suicide forums’.   https://t.co/TmY6iZZrxp

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Over the past 100 days, the UK's had 1000s more deaths than countries with a "Zero Covid" strategy  🇬🇧UK - 12,400 deaths  🇦🇺Australia - 576 deaths 🇰🇷South Korea - 196 deaths 🇨🇳China - 46 deaths inc HK & Macau 🇻🇳Vietnam - 18 deaths 🇦🇺New Zealand - 3 deaths 🇹🇭Thailand - 2 deaths

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: One day there's £16.5bn extra available for military spending  The next there's no money for pay increases for public sector workers who've done so much to help us through this pandemic.  The last decade shows how this Government despises public services & those who work in them.

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: This crisis shouldn't be paid for on the backs of public sector workers.  This crisis shouldn't be paid for on the back of the working class.  The super-rich who have done so well out of our rigged economic system should finally pay their share.  https://t.co/VYLzx9VsSk

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: My call for a public inquiry into the Government's handling of Covid contracts is getting good coverage in our region.  So many Covid contracts have gone to failing private companies - many with links to top Tories.   Only a public inquiry can restore public confidence.  https://t.co/DgLRxDwJ5I

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Keir stood to be Party Leader promising unity in our movement.  But yesterday's unjust decision has created wider divisions in our Party. The Tories are no doubt delighted.  There's an easy and just way to sort this: the Hearing has ruled so now restore the whip to Jeremy Corbyn.

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Proud to join the @unitetheunion picket line at Optare this morning.   Optare workers, including East Leeds residents, are being treated unfairly by their bosses - billionaires who are the UK’s second richest men.   Optare workers deserve the fair pay rise they were promised.  https://t.co/9MiDu7J9kB

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: This morning I joined @unitetheunion members from Optare on their picket line. Solidarity with these striking workers!  https://t.co/m5l8aK2mMz

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: £16,500,000,000 EXTRA in military spending announced today.  That's four-times more than announced yesterday to tackle climate change.  That's money that should be going to feed hungry children, end homelessness, tackle poverty & on a Green New Deal.  Let's build a better future.

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: 529 coronavirus deaths were reported today.   We cannot allow the Government to normalise this level of unnecessary deaths.  It doesn't have to be like this - the Government must change strategy and learn from the countries that are successfully controlling coronavirus.

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Jeremy Corbyn has rightly been reinstated to the Labour Party.  That decision must be respected & implemented across the Labour Party.  Jeremy should immediately have the whip restored.  At a time of national crisis, division in the Labour party serves nobody but the Tory Gov't.

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Vast sums of coronavirus spending are unaccounted for.   The stench of cronyism grows still stronger.  There must be a Public Inquiry into why so many government Covid contracts have gone to failing private companies - many with links to top Tories.  https://t.co/ND0sPOgwuc

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Check out this short video from @CATCHLeeds in Harehills, filmed here in East Leeds before lockdown in March.   It’s inspiring to hear young people from our area talking about how they volunteer daily to develop their skills and help our community.  https://t.co/vDrxfs4iL0

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Delighted that Jeremy has been reinstated.  Jeremy has been a Labour member for 54 years. He's Labour through and through.   Now let's take the fight to the Tories!  https://t.co/X7pKJaKcbK

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: The UK's had 330,000 Covid cases in the past 14 days.   In countries pursuing “Zero Covid”, it's far fewer - just 130 cases in Australia, 38 in New Zealand, 40 in Taiwan, 289 in China, 101 in Vietnam and 88 cases in Thailand.    We need a "Zero Covid" plan  https://t.co/3qDF6bg1qA

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: The Grenfell Inquiry has heard evidence that Celotex, the company that provided the flammable cladding, rigged a fire test to give a misleading impression of the risk it posed.  Those responsible for the Grenfell Tower Fire must be held to account.

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Today is the global day of action against sexual harassment in fast food workplaces  Click this link and write to McDonald’s UK to demand its CEO sits down with worker-survivors and their union - the @bfawu1 - to discuss action to end sexual harassment.   https://t.co/kQl8VHRK9v

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: A vaccine offers real hope – but until it’s widely available we must force the Government onto a new strategy that can save lives & livelihoods.  That means going for ‘Zero Covid’ - which has driven down cases in many countries   My article for @IndyVoices  https://t.co/3qDF6bg1qA

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: NHS staff can't live off applause.  They deserve a pay rise.  https://t.co/EUVwtS1hOo

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: The furlough scheme leaves some workers getting paid less than the Minimum Wage.  The Minimum Wage was a huge step forward in the fight against low pay, it must not be undermined.  Sign here to demand that no worker is paid less than the Minimum Wage.  https://t.co/xPouq5PpRB

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: When the Covid vaccine becomes available, we must ensure it's allocated for free and to those most in need.   No one should be able to buy their way to the front of the queue.  #PeoplenotProfit

tweet: Price hikes for NHS staff during a pandemic must not be allowed to happen. The Government must immediately guarantee free hospital parking.  https://t.co/OhIL3zYJpa

name: Richard Burgon MP

"One of Britain’s most influential lobbyists secretly served as an adviser to a health minister for six months — before sending sensitive information on lockdown policy to paying clients"  https://t.co/ASeYnhttLd

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: NHS staff shouldn't be charged for parking at work.  That many doctors and nurses now face a 200% increase is a disgrace.  We owe our fantastic NHS staff so much. The Government must step in and guarantee free hospital parking.  https://t.co/YZeqEDsgw0

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Nearly FIVE TIMES more workers were paid less than the Minimum Wage this year compared to 2019.  This is completely unacceptable.  Sign here to demand that the Government fix the furlough scheme to make sure no worker gets paid less than the Minimum Wage.  https://t.co/xPouq5PpRB

tweet: There must be a Public Inquiry into how so many of the Covid contracts have gone to failing private companies. Many with links to top Tories.

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Another £43,000,000,000 is to be spent on testing.   This shouldn't be another 'get rich quick' scheme for failing private companies with links to the Tories.   Serco and the like shouldn't get a single penny of this.  It should all be done by the NHS.    https://t.co/97RS1S2bmM

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: A vaccine offers light at the end of the tunnel.  But we still have months & months where we need to be driving down virus levels.  The Government must use this lockdown to fix Test & Trace and to sort a proper economic support system for people isolating and to protect incomes.  https://t.co/oVAIcswvGs

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: At #PMQs, Boris Johnson can't answer why in the battle against Covid £100m's have been wasted on failing private companies - many with links to top Tories.  Funds wasted on PR companies, Serco Test & Trace and £150m on a firm that provided unuseable masks.  Put it all in the NHS!

tweet: We will remember them.  #RemembranceDay2020  https://t.co/EDUgpGfXIa

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: No-one should be paid less than the Minimum Wage.  But hundreds of thousands of furloughed workers are.   This crisis must not be paid for on the backs of low-paid workers.  Sign this petition demanding no-one on furlough is paid less than the Minimum Wage  https://t.co/xPouq5PpRB

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: The Tories have cut 11,237 firefighters’ jobs since 2010.  That's put our communities in danger.  And climate-driven wildfires and floods mean the threats are going to get worse.  That's why I’m backing @fbunational’s campaign for the Government to #FundTheFrontLine  https://t.co/aBbN0de3rI

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Today's Covid vaccine news appears very positive.  This crisis has shown why we need to guarantee health care as a human right.  Access to the vaccine must be based on need - not ability to pay.  It should be freely available to everyone across the world.  People before profit.

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: A Zero Covid strategy is the only way to stop an endless cycle of lockdowns.  The government must use this lockdown to reset its strategy - not repeat the same old failures.  Join me at tonight's People’s Assembly Against Austerity meeting on the need for Zero Covid.  https://t.co/G2jKXfhOvT

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: There are now 187,000 workers in Yorkshire and the Humber - and over 2 million workers nationwide - being paid less than the minimum wage.  That's 5x more than in 2019.  The Chancellor must act now so nobody on furlough is paid less than the minimum wage.  https://t.co/0Q8csHt2BX

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: This lockdown wasn't inevitable.  It's the result of Government failures to control the virus.  I backed it today as a necessary measure. But it's missing key elements.  We now must step up the fight for the closure of schools & universities and proper financial help for people.

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Still hoping that Trump is booted out of office.  We've not got the result we want yet. But one bit of good news is that Cori Bush has been elected.   Her victory speech is exactly the kind of response needed in defence of the 99%.    https://t.co/3zfJcxcadG

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: How dare the PM talk of the failings of "NHS test and trace" ?  The Tories have wasted billions handing it over to Serco and other private companies.  These failing private companies shouldn't get a penny more, the money should go to the NHS & Dido Harding should be sacked. #PMQs

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: We're now at the highest levels of daily Covid deaths since May.  The Government must use lockdown to admit its approach has cost lives & livelihoods and change strategy.  It must: ✅Kick out Serco ✅Sort Test and Trace ✅Provide full sick pay to all isolating ✅Go for Zero Covid

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: I just voted in Parliament against the Overseas Operations Bill.  It is a barrier to justice for victims of torture, murder and war crimes.  I am proud to be one of the 18 Labour MPs who voted against it at Second Reading.  It is right that Labour voted against the Bill tonight.

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Jeremy Corbyn should be re-instated.    My new piece👇   https://t.co/NBHhQiDIy6

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: The Coronavirus crisis people are facing has been deepened and extended by failure after failure by the Tory government.  Last night I told ITV Calendar why a national lockdown which doesn’t include school and university closures won’t be enough to get the virus under control👇👇  https://t.co/lgcSBdYfhJ

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Millions of workers have been paid less than the minimum wage during this crisis.  That's why I've led a campaign for the Government to ensure no furloughed worker gets less than the minimum wage.  It must now act - it's called a minimum wage for a reason.  https://t.co/s3riAyxWrg

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: I asked the Government how many contracts the Department of Health has with Serco, and how much those contracts are worth.  10 days later I got this reply from the Tory Health Minister - who happens to be Serco's former chief spin doctor.  https://t.co/xhIwoM4WHa

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: When right-wing politicians and journalists say we can't do anything to stop Coronavirus, show them these figures.   🇬🇧UK                  - 688 deaths per million people 🇰🇷South Korea   - 9 🇳🇿New Zealand - 5 🇨🇳China             - 3 🇹🇭Thailand         - 1 🇻🇳Vietnam         <1

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Boris Johnson reads out the disastrous Covid news like he's got nothing to do with this mess  He's to blame  ❌Handing testing to Serco ❌Telling people to go out and spend & get back to work ❌Opening schools & universities when not safe ❌Inadequate sick pay for those isolating

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: People have been brilliant throughout this crisis, making huge sacrifices asked of them.  But this Government has totally failed people.  In other circumstances, a government whose failures caused the needless deaths of 10,000s of people and wrecked the economy would resign.

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: @emmadentcoad @YouTube Happy Birthday - hope you still manage to have a decent day x

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: The Government's reckless Coronavirus strategy already means many thousands of unnecessary deaths are predicted this winter.   If they don't lockdown properly this time there'll be even more uneccessary suffering.  A proper lockdown must include schools and universities closing.

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: I was proud to speak in support of the reinstatement of Jeremy at the  event on Friday.  If you missed it, you can watch my contribution and the contribution of other MPs, leading trade unionists and young members here 👇   https://t.co/nJKuamg2Dh  https://t.co/ZFddwDa7gY

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: We need a "People's Bailout” to help people through lockdown:  ◾Nobody on furlough to be paid less than the minimum wage ◾Boost social security to cover real living costs ◾Proper sick pay for all ◾Suspend utility bills ◾Rent relief ◾Food parcels for those in need

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: This lockdown wasn't inevitable.   It's the result of the government's failed strategy. They refused to follow the countries who've best fought Covid.  We must now ensure people get the financial support needed & aren't forced into poverty because of repeated government failures.

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Last night I spoke to BBC Look North about the need for a national circuit breaker lockdown with proper financial support for people to get through this crisis.  https://t.co/3XMiNxSgTL

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: We can't go on like this.   We need a national circuit breaker lockdown now.   With proper financial support so people can get through this crisis.  https://t.co/JdpXPNiXXr

My letter to the Education Secretary 👇  https://t.co/9HffYjsvMq

tweet: Really important that you sign this petition to Reinstate Jeremy Corbyn. He has always stood with us. We must stand with him #IStandWithJeremyCorbyn   https://t.co/nIg65x95jx

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: From Monday Leeds will be under the Government's strictest coronavirus restrictions.  These restrictions were not inevitable, they are a consequence of the Government's failing strategy.  My message to East Leeds residents on tier three restrictions:  https://t.co/7DXJFocao0

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Great stuff from @ParklandsLeeds in Seacroft and @Sukhothai_.   Following free meals for school children, as of 2.15pm free meals for wider distribution - just turn up to Parklands Primary ASAP.   Well done Mr. Dyson and team and inspiring practical action from @Sukhothai_.

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Labour members from across the country have contacted me deeply upset at the decision to suspend Jeremy.  I agree and I'll be working for his reinstatement.  Let's move foward together to fight antisemitism, all forms of racism and Tory attacks on all our communities.

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Across the country the Govt's Covid strategy is failing.   Putting areas like mine into further local restrictions, and without enough funding, just won't cut it.  It's time for a national circuit breaker lockdown with proper financial support to get people through this crisis.

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: In just 24 hours we've had:   ▪️the highest Covid daily death toll since May   ▪️Fears of 25,000 in hospital by the end of November - even higher than the spring peak  ▪️Scientists warning that all of England faces Tier 3 by Xmas  The Government must urgently change strategy

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Don't let the Tories tell you we can't do better in fighting Covid.  I've been calling for 'Zero Covid' because others have effectively eliminated the virus.  🇬🇧UK - 416 cases per 100,000 people (14-day figure) 🇰🇷South Korea - 2 🇳🇿New Zealand - 1 🇦🇺🇻🇳🇨🇳Australia,Vietnam, China <1

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: There are now more Covid patients in Leeds hospitals than at the pandemic's peak.  And 367 more coronavirus deaths across Britain today - the biggest increase since May  This wasn't inevitable and we can still reverse this.  But the Gov't must first admit its strategy is failing.

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Evo Morales' socialist government in Bolivia showed that another world is possible.   In defeating the military-led coup that overthrew Morales, the people of Bolivia have once again shown that the march of progress can't be halted.   My new article 👇  https://t.co/kyN9uIbZRP

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: The Tory Government thinks it’s fair to pay furloughed workers just two-thirds of the minimum wage. It's not.   Today, along with 30 other MPs, I wrote to the Chancellor asking him to ensure no furloughed worker is paid less than the minimum wage.  Read the letter in full 👇  https://t.co/RIRZKL605C

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Covid-19 has shown how severely structural inequality scars our society.  In work, in housing, in healthcare and throughout our society Black, Asian and minority ethnic people face injustice.  The Government must urgently act on Doreen Lawrence's review.   https://t.co/3sNw93UhDb

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Instead of trying to shift the blame for child hunger, Tory MPs need to take responsibility for creating this crisis.   ➡️Wages at levels they were over 10 years ago ➡️Public services trashed through austerity ➡️Rents soaring ➡️Unemployment growing ➡️The benefit freeze

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: The Tory government’s response to Coronavirus has been catastrophic.  Our new Socialist Campaign Group of Labour MPs pamphlet looks at the policies the whole Labour movement needs to fight for to defend people hit hard by this crisis  🌹Download it here  https://t.co/9YbSWsSoyC  https://t.co/ZjjmuKQiHb

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: All child hunger could be abolished overnight. And should be.  It's only our rotten government and the system it serves that means it isn't.

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Wonderful news - and such a relief to all those who’ve been thinking of you and your family.

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: I will never apologise for the transformative policies in our 2017 and 2019 Manifestos.   They gave a glimpse of the better future that people deserve - and is achievable.   As we face a historic crisis and cruel Tory attacks, those kind of policies are needed more than ever.

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: A Tory MP took to Twitter to justify his Party blocking a motion to extend free school meals.   His explanation? He claimed free school meal vouchers this summer effectively meant money going to crack dens and brothels.    The mask slips on a cruel ideology and a rotten system.

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: I’m absolutely appalled to learn of this latest insult to children in our communities.   *Reducing* the amount of support?   Parklands Primary in Seacroft and other schools in East Leeds and across the country need these computers.

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Marcus Rashford's campaign highlighted the cruelty of this Tory government earlier this week.  Today though it's highlighting the wonderful generosity of our communities.  With so much bad news around this is so great to see.

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Handing contracts to Serco and the like isn't just a waste of public funds. It’s meant a failing Test & Trace system that's putting lives at risk.  The Coronavirus crisis is giving a boost to crony capitalism. We need to put an end to it.  My new article👇  https://t.co/kv6ePUBKiE

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Joe Nihill - a well loved and popular 23 year old from Whinmoor - tragically took his own life after accessing online forums containing promotion - and methods - of suicide.   Please sign Joe’s family’s petition to get such online forums closed down.    https://t.co/r7ZYPo1AkH

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Over 400,000 people were infected with Coronavirus last week, new figures show.  The Government has lost control.  It needs to: ◾kick the private companies out of the Test & Trace system ◾implement a circuit breaker lockdown ◾guarantee people's incomes & provide full sick pay

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Furloughed minimum wage workers will soon get just 2/3rds of the minimum wage.  The first time I raised concerns with the Chancellor he said they could find work elsewhere.  Yesterday, he told them to go on Universal Credit.  Nobody should ever be paid less than the minimum wage.  https://t.co/xiKbVu86HU

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: In Parliament today, the Government confirmed to me that furloughed minimum wage workers will be paid just 2/3rds of the minimum wage.  That isn't wrapping your arms around them.   It's kicking them in the teeth.     https://t.co/EZ4HBpyK4n

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: No one should be paid less than a living wage.   Join the call for the Government to increase the minimum wage to at least £10 per hour for all workers.  📝Sign the petition   https://t.co/969yoyS1T3

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Today I asked the Chancellor to guarantee that no furloughed minimum wage worker will be expected to live off less than the minimum wage.  He refused to give that guarantee.  This government is deliberately forcing low paid people into poverty.  https://t.co/6fBfiGuTKX

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: I don't know how those MPs who voted against free school meals tonight can look themselves in the mirror.  https://t.co/lqjO3HCu7M

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: I'm disgusted by what's just happened in Parliament.  Tory MPs just voted down extending free school meals over the Christmas holiday.  They know this will mean 1 million kids going hungry. They just don't care.  A sickening display of Tory contempt for people in our communities.

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: More and more people will be forced to live off just 2/3rds of their wages in the coming weeks under new restrictions.  That's just not right.   In Parliament, I just voted for a fair national package of support for local areas including 80%+ furlough.  The Tories voted it down.

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: This Tory MP claims providing free school meals in the school holidays "increases dependency".  In order to promote some bizarre ideological views about the state, he seems happy for kids to go to bed hungry each night.   They're kids. They need to eat. End of.  https://t.co/mcdXY43YYz

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: “We want to go on with our commonsensical approach” declares blinkered Boris Johnson at #PMQs with the baseless self-confidence of someone who believes they’re born to rule.  His government’s approach is losing so many lives and costing so many jobs .   Why won’t he think again?

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Today I will be voting in Parliament to extend free school meals over the school holidays.  In one of the world's richest countries, the least we can expect is that children don't go to bed not knowing where their next meal is coming from.  The Government must support this today.

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: They treat people like fools.

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: The Government is expecting many people in Manchester who work for businesses forced to shut to now live on 2/3rds of the minimum wage.  That's £5.81 for those aged 25+  That's £5.47 for those aged 21-24  That's £4.30 for those aged 18-20  They're forcing people into poverty.

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Boris Johnson is treating the people of Greater Manchester with contempt.  And let's be clear. What he's doing there today he'll do to other working-class communities tomorrow.  @AndyBurnhamGM is right to stand up to the PM and demand proper support to defend lives & livelihoods.

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Millions more could soon be put in Tier 3 according to the press.  They'll need proper support. They can’t live off furlough that's just ⅔ of their wages.  The Government needs to stop treating the North with contempt & stop trying to fight Coronavirus on the cheap in our areas.

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: In Parliament I asked Matt Hancock why other countries have managed to drive down the number of Coronavirus cases to very low levels, while his government is about to oversee a second wave of unnecessary deaths.  https://t.co/nqR84WLEPj

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Tonight I voted in Parliament for an amendment to secure safe passage for child refugees and protect their right to family reunion.  The Government voted it down.  How do they sleep at night?

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: From today Labour members can vote in our Party’s important National Executive Committee elections.   I’m proud to back the Grassroots Voice Team (@LauraPidcock @MizJama @AnnDHenderson @Yasmine_Dar @mish_rahman and @gembolton) and hope you’ll back them too. https://t.co/uszV0LTDdf

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: So many will be sending love and best wishes to Yasmin.   Like so many people in Bolton, across the country and in other countries too, I am thinking of Yasmin and her family at this difficult time and hoping for a swift and full recovery.

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: @itrainedflowers During campaigns we are fuelled not only by energy drinks but by socialism too!

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Congratulations Jacinda Arden and @nzlabour on this fantastic election victory.   They have inspired New Zealand with their vision and delivered on protecting lives and livelihoods with a successful ‘Zero Covid’ strategy.

name: Richard Burgon MP

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: The whole Labour movement should unite behind Independent Sage's Emergency Six Week Plan to fight Coronavirus.

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Right-wing journalists like to rubbish the idea of 'Zero Covid'.  They want you to think we can't tackle Covid.  Here's the truth.  🇬🇧UK 213,000 cases over past 14 days 🇰🇷S.Korea 1,083 🇨🇳China (inc Hong Kong & Macau) 338 🇦🇺Australia 266 🇹🇭Thailand 94 🇳🇿New Zealand 32 🇻🇳Vietnam 29

name: Richard Burgon MP
tweet: Yesterday, in an online event in support of a Zero Covid strategy, as well as experts like @DeviSridhar, a representative from the Coronavirus Bereaved Families group spoke. She’d lost her dad.   We must guard against an inhumane dismissal of so many deaths and major illnesses.

name: Richard Burgon MP

tweet: Serco has just told their shareholders to expect a big boost to profits because the Government has given them extensions on Test & Trace contracts.  Serco Test & Trace is failing.  Boot out these failing outsourcing giants and put the NHS in charge.  https://t.co/EcOp1K9QPQ
